intro: Hieracium hyparcticum, commonly known as the northern hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to northern regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides, and it thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium hyparcticum is often considered an invasive species in some areas due to its rapid spread and competitive growth.
